US Democrats, defeated by Trump a year ago, grapple with a grassroots rebellion
subhead: As Tuesday's special elections approach, the party is fractured, with no clear leader or unified message, as activists push for new priorities and a shake-up of its entrenched establishment.

title: Israel hands over bodies of 45 Palestinians after Hamas returns remains of 3 soldiers
Sudan: The UAE's shady role and Western nations' 'culpable indifference'
Shein bans all sex dolls after France's outrage over 'childlike' figures
subhead: Earlier on Monday, France's finance minister had threatened to ban the retailer from the country if it resumed selling the childlike dolls, just days before it opens its first physical store in Paris.

title: Tanzania president sworn in as opposition says hundreds killed in protests
subhead: Hassan, who was inaugurated for a second term on Monday, was elevated from vice president after the sudden death of her predecessor John Magufuli in 2021. Election day, despite a heavy security presence, descended into chaos, with Hassan calling for 'unity and solidarity' in her speech, promising a return to normality.

title: Charles Coste, world's oldest living Olympic champion, dies at 101
subhead: The former French cyclist, a gold medalist in the team pursuit at the 1948 London Games, carried the Olympic flame during the opening ceremony of the Paris 2024 Games. He died on Thursday at the age of 101.

title: Rosalía returns with mystical album: 'God has given me so much, the least I could do is make an album for him'
subhead: Three albums and a string of hit singles have propelled her to the ranks of global pop divas. After a three-year hiatus, the 33-year-old Catalan artist returns with 'Lux,' a musical fresco in praise of the divine and major female saints.

Maho Bah-Villemagne, transgender boxer: 'Not many people are concerned that I was born female and can get punched by men'
subhead: One year after his first fight in the men's category, the athlete stepped back into the ring on Saturday in Marseille. He reflects on his journey and criticizes the persistent misconceptions about gender in the world of sports.

title: France's new 'unproductive wealth' tax reflects a limited adjustment
subhead: MPs approved on Friday a modification of the real estate wealth tax. Its base was broadened, but the tax rate was reduced by a third for the very wealthy. Its yield remains unclear.

title: The Orient Express pulls up in Paris: An opulent journey into the 1920s
subhead: The legendary luxury train is making a stop at Paris's Musée des Arts Décoratifs until spring. As part of the major exhibition dedicated to the centenary of Art Deco, three life-size mock-ups of the new Orient Express, set to return to service soon, are on display.
